page.title: 01Stevington
page.content: Stevington village is situated six miles northwest of Bedford,the nearest town.It is a small village of about two hundred and forty dwellings some of which date back several centuries.The population is just over six hundred. The surrounding countryside is farmed and consists mainly of cornfields and grazing land.The village is served by a public bus service.The eighteenth century windmill is a popular place for sightseers.Only a few employment situations exist within the village,the majority of people travelling further afield to work.The nearest village is Bromham,two miles east of Stevington.
